actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend section 1201 of title 18 of the United States Code to clarify the intent of the Congress by creating a presumption that a person who voluntarily agrees to travel with another to a particular destination, but does not arrive at such destination after a reasonable period of time, is inveigled or decoyed, within the meaning of such section.

summary.text: Creates a presumption that a person who voluntarily agrees to travel with another to a particular destination, but does not arrive at such destination after a reasonable period of time, is inveigled or decoyed.

titles.title: A bill to amend section 1201 of title 18 of the United States Code to clarify the intent of the Congress by creating a presumption that a person who voluntarily agrees to travel with another to a particular destination, but does not arrive at such destination after a reasonable period of time, is inveigled or decoyed, within the meaning of such section.
